I must say it has rarely been that hard to watch a movie. It has been impossible to understand what the actors have been saying in English, the humour was extremely puerile and the plot has unfortunately not made it to the film yet. We fought extremely hard, and successfully made it to 40% of the film. We will try to finish it again in some time if it there is a storm outside.
Dreadful. How can such an average and cheap production storyline generate such interest ....?
Best movie of the year !! Has everything action, comedy , just about make your cry at the end.

I have never walked out of a movie in my entire life and this was the first. Couldn't make it through more than an hour of it. Overall, I felt the story telling was exceptionally poor with way to many jumps and transitions. The amount of sexual scenes and devices on screen was appalling and there are far too many continuity breaks for anyone to enjoy. Truly it felt like a woke version of inception that couldn't resist to add in a plethora of vulgarity and anti-white racism. Not to mention whoever wrote it has less than a high schoolers understanding of physics, metaphysics, and spatial awareness. I would wager they hired zero consultants for anything scientific, mathematic, or engineering based.

Probably the worst movie I have ever seen hands down. You would have to pay me at least 4 figures to entertain watching it again.
it was a roller-coaster of emotions and I will watch it again

An Asian Matrix-like theme. It has great acting and the casting is perfect.  It deserves all the accolades and nominations. Watching it on gummies only enhances the viewing. The overall message… The Everything Bagel is the ultimate Meaning of Life!
It's chaotic yet well paced. It's absurd yet meaningful. It's ridiculous yet beautiful.

I must admit that there were some elements of this film that I found interesting. The acting was adequate, and the first thirty minutes were entertaining. However the rest of the movie was a bit of a mess. The repetitive kung-fu fight sequences went on far too long. It just started to bore me after a while. Had they edited or eliminated a few of those scenes, they could have reduced its two hour and twelve minute runtime down to a more watchable one and a half hours.

I didn't expect to have to take the title literally. Ratatouille meets 2001 meets Crouching Tiger. Without a doubt, the most original movie since Pan's Labyrinth. At 139 minutes, it's about a third too long and that's just about the time you reach the point of exhaustion.

The most disgusting movie I ever watched. I found it is full of examples of racial stereotypes and purposely ulgify Chinese male. The storyline is like a deformed monster meshed together with Tiktok like dopamine induce tasteless clips.
Hands down, best movie of 2022!

This film is nothing like you have ever seen before. The title says it all! The actors are wonderful, the craziness keeps you watching until the very last second.
The most heartfelt and thought provoking movie of the year. An absolute masterpiece with terrific acting. Who would of thought A24 would have made the best multiverse movie of the year.
A really funny and entertaining movie to watch, that sometimes tries to be more emotional than it's meant to be

I watched this movie due to the highly rated reviews and its many nominations. What a disappointment! Maybe it’s only me, but this is not a movie I would ever recommend to anyone I know. Neither would I ever vote for it to get any awards. Please NO!

I came to this movie after having it reccomendedd and after seeing how many Oscars for which it had been nominated. I tried hard, really hard to find some redeeming features, but after 30 minutes I gave up. Completely lacking in drama, wit, excitement., it e=was just a whole  load of fighting with some kind of explanation of what was going on, delivered at breakneck speed. Absolutely horrible!
What. Why. When. What. probably one of quite a few films that need another view to see/ work out what is going on. Do try to watch it sober as you may need a third go!
Michelle Yeo, I have loved you for decades. Great movie.

This is worst movie I have seen in 5 years! It has not real plot and it was boring despite a few action scenes. A real stinker…

I tried to watch this film, based on the great buzz. It was unwatchable. I turned it off after 90 minutes and watched a truly fine film, "She Said," instead.

How did this awful movie get 95%?  

Did the reviewers actually watch this thing?

Worst movie I've seen in years.  Hands down.

The one movie that marked my year 2022. It's been a long time that I feel so refreshing and amazed at a movie, really enjoy the roller coaster of emotions while watching. I didn't know it was a comedy until I watched it so the added flavor kicked in so much fun. I read somebody said that its flow of events were such a mess that they cannot follow but I didn't have any problem understanding it. The life of main character is scattering unsolved layers of problems so it's supposed to be chaotic, and in chaos and frustration and fear and despair that we find ourselves, if we hold on to our core value strongly enough. I'm so happy to find such a strong message being conveyed through a story of a domestic Asian immigrant family where the mother is the hero and the father, opposite to Hollywood's formula of supporting role who are so bland and unimportant, helps the mother every time she's in critical moments to see through herself and figure the right track. No success is achieved alone! 
It also tackles the generation gap question that a lots of Asian have growing up with their families, to let them be or to direct them in a supposedly good track. Can't say enough of my thinking after watching this movie but go into it cold and feel it yourself. Don't go to a movie after watching tons of reviews and a judgmental attitude to compare the movie with your favorites, or even too highly expect from a lot of praises, it'll ruin your genuine experience with a good, or if I would say, a great movie.
Acting 10/10, directing 10/10, script 10/10, visual effects 10/10, story 10/10. Probably the best movie of 2022.

My GOD, how in the hell did this movie become what it is right now?

I  looked forward to this movie because reviews made it sound like something unique and revolutionary. 

I gave up after 50 minutes because it just got absurd and never gained any grounding. 

It has no purpose or interest to keep you invested.

No idea why this movie won awards. This movie is extremely tedious. 

You can't trust anything anymore because our system is so hyper focused on the wrong aspects of everything, everywhere all the time.

I really have to learn to stop valuing mainstream opinions.
I wasted 2 hours of my life. I kept waiting for this movie to show me why it had an 89% audience score but it never did. This movie with its 11 Oscar nominations is a complete mess.
Unique story and angle.  Performances from actors were great.

I can think of a dozen movies that use the multiple universe concept 10x better, and if its about nihilistic philosophy you can do it 100x better. Its almost unwatchable, idk what people are smoking easily the worst movie I've watched this year had to force myself to keep watching it after the first 15min.
need to fire james gunn

It's too much. It's so in your face that it just becomes annoying. It's way too long. The jokes are immature and stupid. And the movie has like 17 different climaxes. Pacing nightmare. Appreciate the originality, but still very bad.
Stupid movie. Hollywood has lost its mind…again

This was a life shattering piece of work. 

It's truly hard to explain what's happening here, its like every genre in one and quite violent at times but in the end it's just a hopeful tale about humanity.
Nothing really matters what we do on this floating rock, and with the right person even taxes and laundry are beautiful. 
Even the smallest decision in your life, could change the course of it forever. And you never know where you will end up at the end of the day. And in the end it all just comes down to love.

We all take each other and our life way too seriously (I myself am constantly guilty of that). Why can't we just be a rock overlooking the valley? And just be.

I didn't get everything from the movie but that was unnecessary either. The feeling it provoked and the messages I took from it, and the insane creativity and freshness of the whole thing was so breathtaking. 

 THIS IS WHY I LOVE CINEMA. This is what cinema can do. This is what cinema can be.
This is why I want to creative something that makes other people feel the exact same way I felt when I watched this. For a little while this made me fall in love with life again. And everything that encapsulates it.

Hang in there, guys. There will be sunshine after rain, these things have always been the same. So why worry now.

Life is always worth it.
Great plot and interesting concept with multiverse

Oh my god! this movie is the defination of overrated the pace was slow as hell comedy was a bit funny action scenes were terrible because of slow motion and the topic was serious but it failed to build up the seriousness and the most annoying part was they were speaking chinese like half of the time why even realease in english or in america
I don't understand the high rating others gave this movie.  I understand the Oscar nominations for your actors, but the movie itself was one of the dumbest I've seen.

Ridiculous, boring and stupid. These words come to mind after first 15 minutes. Chinese migrant cliches, chinese fighting movies cliches... If I were an Asian actor, I would be embarresed to participate in this absurdity. Do wonder this monstrocity was nominated for an Oscar.
One of the best movies of the Year, the plot, the editing, everything is just great and works absolutely well with the multiverse theme
I can't stop thinking about this movie, it gave me so much to reflect on and remember and look forward to. It's breathtakingly genius and easily in my top 5 films of all time.

This is a movie for the herd. They'll follow each other with their top ratings, too scared to be left out of their peer group. This is a movie that may win awards but it will be forgotten in 5 to 10 years. It's an utter mess of a film, funny if you have no contemporary sense of humour, confusing and annoying at every turn. this is a true story.

Excelente filme.

This is a movie you have to watch and not be distracted by other things. Fortunately it grabs your attention from the beginning and doesn't let go for the entire film. Well acted by the cast all around. Story is creative and at some points just hilarious. But also has a lot of feeling and heart.
Slick direction, crazy editing, outstanding performances, and heartfelt writing. This multi-genre film is flawless.
Honestly, this is probably my favourite movie, it is just what the fuck in the best way possible

This was an action movie pretending to be something else. But it doesn't fool people who really hate action movies. The first half of the film quickly dropped all pretensions and escalated into mindless violence. I don't know about the second part because I left, but I hear it was more of the same.

I'm new to Rotten Tomatoes as a reviewer but felt I had to start after seeing Everything, everywhere all at once.   This film does live up to its title, similar to a chef throwing everything in the cupboard into a stew, then blending it, then freezing it, then throwing into the street for something to eat it.  Simply:  a mess.  I get it, some filmmakers want to reach for the stars by including every idea and filmmaking trick in the book, but I'm not along for the ride.  This film reminds me of a mash up of Kubrick/Tarantino/Wachowski techniques at 78 RPM.  Yuck.

Best film of the year?  A further decline of western civilization I say.  Two hot dog thumbs down…
Amazing, I laughed, cried and everything in between.

Creative, well-acted and executed, chaotic at the same time not for everyone I think. I'm Asian but couldn't laugh, much more like care-free Chinese mentality in it. But this is ambitious and definitely made for now, everyone is burned-out these days. For visual and action, this belongs to the family tree of Matrix, Kill Bill and Enter the Dragon eventually. Monty python like absurdism for conceptually. Production quality is high.
Self-indulgent try-hard

I can see why the actors are up for awards, but what a weird movie. I don't expect everything to be Schindlers list, but wow, this was a trip. When the credits finally rolled, my eyes squinted and I questioned it all.

An extraordinarily inventive, often hilarious, often moving and always borderline bonkers juggernaut of a movie. The entire cast are absolutely on point with impressive supporting turns from James Hong and Jamie Lee Curtis especially. However this is very much the wonderful Michelle Yeoh's movie and she is utterly fantastic. Whilst I've very much enjoyed Yeoh's work in many films and series previously, this is quite possibly her best role to date and that in itself is very high praise indeed. A genuine sci-fi masterpiece, which boasts superb special effects, direction, musical score and a truly great script. One of my favourite movies in many a year. It has more invention, heart and wit in five minutes than most films these days have in their entire running time. Absolutely fantastic. A triumph.
The emperor has no clothes. Somebody in the media needs to stand up and admit it's awful. Trash. Ridiculous.

Chinese art trash disguised as a
philosophical metaphor about life's true meaning. Worst movie I've ever watched to the end, thinking all along there must be a
movie somewhere, but there wasn't.
So typical of critics and the Academy 
to imbue this film with undeserved meaning
and associated theatrical value.
Less than Zero, as the song goes …

Simple everyday family story gets thrown into a blender with glitter and different colors. It's really not that creative, but more of a kaleidoscope mess to watch, one keeps waiting for this movie to make some kind of a point…It never does.  Unless you're one of those who thinks throwing different colored paint at a canvas is the pinnacle of creativity you're going to be wondering why anyone thinks this movie is more than one and a half stars out of five.  Do you really want to award a movie like this one?  Do you really want this kind of low bar at the theater?  Not me friend.
I wanted to love it, but I barely liked it. It’s just too much, everywhere, all at once. The acting is very good but it gets diluted by the nonsense.
Honestly, I see nothing here. I watched it with a group of three and after 45 minutes we all agreed to flip over to Nope. We thought that one was pretty good.

I haven't bothered watching this movie for some time because I found nothing interesting in the movie trailer or summary. Today I sat down to watch it because I read that it will dominate the Oscars and i only made it through the first 50 mins of it. Maybe not for me.

Honestly thought this film made no sense. Just the director and writer hoping something would stick.
Adolescent and boring… waste of time
Turned off in 15 minutes.  Seriously the worse movie I've seen in about 20 years
We hated it. Disjointed, weird and long.

I did not get this movie and did not think it was great at all.  I watched it twice, it made a lot more sense the second time, but It didn't move me or entertain me.  The daughter is not a great actress and difficulty to look at, the husband bloomed like a lotus flower at the end, but Jaime Lee Curtis did not add.  I just did not like this movie much.
Michelle Yeoh should get her long overdue Oscar for this film. Story, acting, and script are all on point as well.

I'm at a loss on this one. It's got rave reviews but honestly after the first 30 or 40 minutes of letting us know that "nothing really matters" it spends the next 1 1/2 hours regurgitating the same premise in a thousand repetitive ways. And the humor, if you want to call it that, was sophomoric at best. I think critics feel compelled to like this one due to what the writers and directors were trying to achieve for today's world.  It's like the emperor who has no clothes. No one wants to admit that this movie really isn't all that.

I am really kind of sick and tired of the Hollywood PR machine telling folks what's great and just soooooooooooo amazing.  

This movie was awful. I clung to the idea that I love Michele Yeoh and I remember Crouching Tiger and other brilliant films like Crazy Rich Asians....I cannot believe her decision to put her name to this garbage.  As other reviewers said, this was so unwatchable....I stopped at about 35 minutes in, waiting for the POINT if ever these screenplay writers would come to if and when the drugs stopped flowing.

Guys. You're NEVER going to catch the lightning that was Brazil. Never. There isn't a screenwriter alive now that isn't just trying to get PR for themselves by making "controversial" movies.   Seriously. Holding a dildo while kung-foo-ing your other mother in a different multiverse....just stupid. Absolutely d!ck and fart jokes on acid.

AWFUL. Unwatchable. Embarrassed for a class act like Michele Yeoh and her colleagues....except, of course, for Jamie Lee Curtis, who is a nepo-baby clown with zero talent to begin with...so there's that. Cast into a role that pretty much says it all about her.

It's all just the Hollywood PR machine trying to keep the momentum of "actors who aren't WASPS" going, undeservedly so.  PARASITE was subtle, classy and moving. There is NOTHING "moving" about this trash. Nothing. This was some screenwriter's acid trip one weekend and they still think this juvenile garbage is just so hilarious.

Don't bother watching it. It's time you will never get back.
Absolute masterpiece. Loved every minute of it
Absurdly graphic and disgusting. These NC—17 jokes would never be allowed if it was happening to women.

The best movie I have ever seen in theaters, and, possibly, the best movie I have seen in my lifetime. Definitely the most impactful. From laughs to tears, Everything Everywhere All at Once brought me through a roller-coaster of emotions (not only during my first watch). More importantly, it was profoundly thought provoking, and I will keep watching it regularly to try and positively impact my way of life. It truly is the masterpiece of a generation. Thank you for everything.
I despised this movie.

Coming into this movie, I was expecting something like the Matrix, full of action, strange sci-fi plot. What was delivered was sooooo much more than anything I could have imagined. It has a bit of everything. Action, check. Comedy, check. Drama, check. Incredible story, check. Amazing acting, check. I was so pleasantly surprised by this movie. So many emotions packed into one masterpiece of a movie. If you are on the fence about watching this, DO IT!! But please give it the attention it deserves. This is not the movie to have on in the background while you do other things. Maybe if you are watching it for the second, or third time, but not the first. I was enthralled start to finish.

I think that I read that it's an assault on the senses. It is.  I can't imagine the movie put into words in a screenplay.  The film editor must have been smoking bad pot the whole time.  I'm glad that I didn't pay to see it in a movie theater.  I expect that the viewer can detect the theme of the movie, but the visualization is disjointed at best and js hard to follow because it seems so random.  The motivation to watch it through is the curiosity to see how it arrives at a conclusion.
It was decent but had a bunch of cliched sets that just grated the wrong way. The action sequences were good and I liked Quan's and Curtis' acting
This movie was amazing. I have never had a movie feel so personal. It really has something everyone can relate too.
The writers much of been high as a kite for this movie quite literally the dumbest movie I've ever seen

I just don't understand the hype. It's halfway through the movie and I'm soooo bored.  It's just ridiculous. People jumping all around karate kicking and hitting each other and supposedly jumping from one universe to the other. It goes on and on and on. I've been watching it for an hour and I give up. Just way too stupid.
Weird and definitely would not watch again. I can't say I liked anything about it really other than it finally ended.

I went into this thinking: "Michelle Yeoh-good. Multiverse-good. Indie movie-let's go! And my mind was blown. I laughed, and wept, and remembered what this absurd, messy life is really about: being kind like Waymond, being willing to learn and grow like Evelyn, and when, like Joy (as Jobu Tupaki) the world is the unending, negative, overwhelming hellscape of screens and collective isolation and tragedy we have all experienced the last five years; that even when stuck in a nihilistic depression hell, (as I and many people have been) It's okay to collapse into the arms of your Mom, no matter how imperfect her love is.. Masterpiece. ✍

An indescribable experience. Vulgar and heartfelt, confusing and straightforward, outrageously funny and outstandingly sad. It is everything a movie can be, and more, slapped on a bagel with cream cheese. I cannot get it out of my head, and I cannot do any less than urge others to get it in their heads too.
Crazy but amazing. WOW!
Best movie I've seen since Interstellar. Incredibly well done, fantastic performances all around, captivating and unique plot. Highly recommend.
This thing is brimming with joy and storytelling prowess.

Are you kidding me? 95% critic score??  What a mess...no discernible plot as a starting point.  I rarely give up on a movie, but after 30 minutes I was ready to stop watching.  I forged ahead; however, after 45 minutes...knowing there was another 90 minutes to go...I saw no way of rehabilitation for this movie.  It's utter nonsense and a waste of time.  I'm absolutely shocked at the number of Oscar nominations.  Is this movie really where the movie industry wants to hang its hat for 2022??  This is definitely one of the worst movies I have ever attempted to watch.
entertaining, heartfelt, and a wonderful ride.
My comment is simple: boring and repetitive. OKOK, you want to say I just dont understand what is multiuniverse?
Such a phenominal movie. All of the acting is incredible, and so are the special effects, the plot, and it is entertaining as hell. Truly everything you could want in a movie.

Fantastic!  It's incrediblely cinematic.  Though I have a great big screen at home, wish I had seen this in the theater.  It's quite confusing at times, but that is part of the ride, and it was a wild ride.  The casting and acting was off the charts perfect.

Original and crazy. But there is a lot. Because of it I am not interested of dramatic part. On the contrary comedy part is well and the movie has many original things. I really like the movie, but i don't remember story since I get out of a cinema.

Think It's a Wonderful Life meets the Matrix.  This strange concoction is utterly barmy and yet still touching.  It feels like an allegory to me, but it makes (no) sense equally as a literal story.
This film demands your concentration, but even if you zone out for a moment you won't lose the thread, as events pile on top of each other with little apparent logic.  You could probably watch it backwards.  Fine acting holds your attention and your emotions though.
This film makes me feel better about the future of cinema.

The humour in this movie was at best juvenile and childish, and at worst disgusting. Terrible disjointed scripting, plot elements that went no where, poorly edited with some scenes that were excessively long and just not funny at all. How anyone can make the comment "best movie ever" is beyond me. Would strongly recommend not seeing this movie.

Overrated.
Don't forget that a lot of what this movie does was already done by The Matrix decades ago.
It disappointed me and caused hyperglycemia. I was about to walk out of the room, as very few times in my life, but the talented cast was the only thing that kept me tolerating so much overload of everything until the end.
An absolute must see. It may go over some people's heads, but if you can comprehend what's going on, this movie will have your mind racing, pulling together all of the layers to this cinematic onion.
É tão incrível, caótico e bonito. A mensagem é simples e preciosa. Dá espaço pra atrizes sênior brilharem. É o Dr Estranho no Multiverso da Loucura que deu certo. É um filme coração.
Perfect mix of existentialism, comedy, and sadness. A movie that has made me feel more than any other in recent times.

Really enjoyed it. Great cast. there was so much humor and drama, yet there was never any awkward tone shifts. Yes as SCI FI we've seen some of the devices before, but it never felt overly derivative.

My favorite movie of the year. The concept, the execution, the direction, the destination - a big delicious sloppy (in the best way) goulash of a film. So imaginative, so dazzling. Michelle Yeoh and the rest of the cast are superb. A dazzling experience.

Easily the best movie Ive ever seen.  Its as if they bottled up all of the creativity movies these days lack and put it all into one film.  Worth giving a try regardless of your movie tastes.  This  isnt just a movie.  Its art.
One of the best movies ever made in 2022.
The actresses and actors were amazing! The effects seemed extremely real! The script, the cuts, the music selection, the casting, everything was the best option for the film, and it shows!!

A superbly acted movie that doesn't have the story it's actors deserve. As with most scifi adventures, there are layers to this story. We start with our main character's situation and current conflicts (of which she has several). As the more fantastical elements enter the story, we expect to see how these new experiences parallel what is happening in her life. Then ultimately we expect that those experiences, coupled with new skills and fresh perspective, will help her attack her real world issues. This happens, but not in a satisfying way.
It's absolutely stunning. A new way of doing movies, a real invention. I can't stop thinking about this movie.
Truly amazing. Must watch this movie.
Great acting. Too absurdist for me.

My two sons, one of which studied film at the university, and the other who has learned all about it from his big brother are usually my guinea pigs. I rely on them to scope out for me before I go. In the world of arthouse cinema where those prestige directors are recycling the same frames, the same aesthetics and the same score, Daniel Kwan and Daniel Scheinert show us a beacon of hope of how we can use our maximal creativity to make a story happen. 

The core of this amazing creative movie is a beautiful family drama, husband and wife, father and daughter, mother and daughter. Daniels make us laugh and cry, and they progress this story so masterfully to the point where we all bawl like a baby in the end. 

Those established and prestige filmmakers should learn a lesson from this. This is the level of sincerity that movies lack nowadays.

Without a doubt, best movie I saw the entire year. Far beyond any franchise or sequel or reboot. And it certainly covers both "Multiverse" and "Madness" better than the MCU. Ke Huy Quan in particular does a fantastic job portraying three distinct versions of Waymond Wang: The loving and bumbling father and husband, the wistful romantic CEO, and the competent but melancholic resistance fighter. Michelle Yeoh absolutely shines as Evelyn Yang. And the core theme may not be remotely new (being a core tenet of Buddhism) but it's still beautiful: "Life has no meaning. So what? We'll give it meaning."

I've said I never need to hear the term "multiverse" again. This is an exception… As much as the final message is a simple one, there's so much going on here — given the infinite possibilities of infinite multi-verses — to keep the viewer entertained throughout the 140-minute runtime. Yes, the concept can devolve into a Family Guy bit of "RANDOM THING/PERSON interacts with RANDOM THING/PERSON for interest or comedic effect," but the plot, somehow, stays grounded enough to balance funny situations and endearing moments — I loved the "rock universe," while the "hotdog fingers universe" could've been stripped-down to a scene or two. Every character has to give a range because of the range of multiverses in which each character appears. Michelle Yeoh as our protag, Evelyn, is the star, but the whole Wang Family (Stephanie Hsu, Ke Huy Quan, James Hong), also deserves praise. Jamie Lee Curtis as Deirdre, an IRS Agent in whatever you call the starting-verse, is the perfect antagonist (and also friend, love interest, etc.). We all knew (yes, you're included in this) that her IRS trophies that adorned her administrative office resembled giant buttplugs — I appreciate that "The Daniels" followed the "Chekhov's Gun" rule in that regard. It's not the easiest to review, but I will say this, Everything Everywhere All at Once is the kind of movie that gives me hope. It's original, comprehensive in approach, but simple in message, fun, and funny. It can be enjoyed at home, but perhaps bolstered by a theater viewing. I love Swiss Army Man and didn't realize EEAaO was only their second full-feature collaboration. When I had been set in my thinking that anything original will only come from foreign filmmakers, I finally get to this. I hope it comes away with some hardware at the Oscars. There's also lots of Kung Fu.

🔥 RATED PHOENIX 🔥

I'm just going to go around in circles for this review, so for a tl;dr: Everything Everywhere All At Once is perfection. It's a rapturous cinematic experience that takes the viewer on an emotional rollercoaster through existential dread, the crushing burden of expectations, and the overwhelming nature of life. It's funny, ridiculous, poignant, and, above all, unashamedly hopeful. In spite of its themes, Everything reminds us that, even when the world overwhelms us and brings us to our lowest, there are moments, moments when, sometimes, just sometimes, we can overwhelm the world.

For a more in-depth look and more posts like this, visit my site: https://thephoenixprjct.com/everything-everywhere-all-at-once-in-depth-review/

Every once and a while a movie comes along that moves you in a way that makes you feel like you might want to change your life, and that it's not too late. It's been long enough to where I can't remember the last movie that did it, but this one did.

A delightful and powerful insight into many topics. Love, work, expectations, living in the moment, and more. So many ideas that were beautifully executed in both witty and realistic dialogue, and also in cinematography. 

The humor was smart and observant; and the dialogue to be had was reminiscent of reality. Though it still included hilarious absurdism and wild hypotheticals.

The most prominent aspect of the film in my eyes was the dialogue between parent and child. The misunderstandings and generational differences that clash constantly. The misinterpretation of intentions, and lack of expression at times. If you're watching this film with your teenage or adult child, or alternatively with your parents; there's a lot to discuss when it's done.

The odds of tears flowing are high, and the deeper conversations that could stem from watching this beautiful film are even higher. 

Regardless of whether or not you will hate it after you're done, it's a film that deserves at least one honest watch from everyone.

The multiverse is a dangerous concept that can easily strip stories of meaning if not handled properly. Everything Everywhere All at Once reaps all the comedic and cool benefits of this concept without falling into the pitfalls, the story not only retains an important message despite the sporadic setting but even manages to enhance its point because of it – masterfully executed. A student film with extraordinarily high production values. The idea that iterations of oneself has a nexus to the to the dominant reality is very weak and produces an uncompelling narrative. It is just a device required for the visual feast of variations. Quality here (and perhaps the great ratings) is defined by the quantity of wonderfully mad historical vignettes. But the trivial "jumps" that preface these scenes of other realities becomes stale too in an overly long movie that says little but tries to shore it up with some poignant family moments. The acting is brilliant, yet I hope not to meet this farrago again in another universe.

When a movie is not only impactful but also inspiring and intelligent, it is the rare movie that can stand the test of time. Everything Everywhere All at Once is the movie that brings out all the emotions inside a human body. Creativity and smooth timing are its apparent strengths, especially creativity which has been slowly disappearing in mainstream cinema.
It made Doctor Strange 2 look like a Golden Raspberry Award winner. All the characters had moments to shine without the pace being too dragged. The story & setup clicked and built up to an unforgettable climax. Even the stones which didn't talk were not illogical nonsense as you watched the movie. The madness of mixing the elements surprisingly produced an intense flavour of enjoying life, similar to what all of us are encountering every day as humanity.
It definitely deserved multiple-watching and each time it gave different meanings to your time spent. It is truly a gem of independent cinema.

One of my favourite (Yes yes I'm Canadian and spell things strange haha) things to do in January is go through people's lists of top films from the last year - this one was on a ton of lists so I had to finally check it out. 
And boy, this movie is extremely odd. It ultimately completely lives up to it's name, because they certainly threw just about everything everywhere all at once. It had me in the first half, I could follow it, and I even found it was a really cool concept. but somewhere around an hour 15/ hour and a half it just totally lost me. I think the cast was actually really great for what they were given, but I don't understand how this movie scores so high with everyone everywhere. Personally I think that people latch onto the bizarre spectacle that it definitely is full of, things like Dirk Gently or Rick and Morty are full of. It just got a little muddled down by this for me, and the grounded story it was trying to tell ultimately just fell away - by the end I couldn't care any less for Evelyn or her little family. Maybe that's the point - the multiverse is so big, so why care about these small parts of it - but I like to think this film was trying to tell the opposite, and perhaps it succeeded in doing so for all those who rate it higher, it just didn't for me.

Really liked this movie. Might need to watch it a couple times too get all of it.
This movie was way overhyped imo. It's okay in a quirky way, but nothing special about it made me think it was anything other than an average movie. Not a movie I'll ever want to watch again.
Poignant, original, and timely. This movie has a simple, yet powerful, message, a knock-out cast of actors, and an aesthetic that feels fresh, new, and bursting with creativity.

I have never watched a film where I have been compelled to leave it a review. Everything Everywhere All at Once is the lone exception. From start to finish I was left absolutely confused about what was happening on screen, but I couldn't stop watching. It was just... beautiful. The soundtrack, the message, the acting, everything. Absolutely stunning.

One of the coolest and most unique films i've seen. Hits all the marks. Some people will find it silly or confusing, and at some points it is, but thats part of its charm. It definitely has some good messages. Great performances across the board as well.
Calling this movie a fantasy sci-fi doesn't cover it at all... stunning in every way. Got to the end and immediately just wanted to enjoy it all over again.
A film that isn't repetitive or derivative. This is a fun unique experience.
A movie version of a Guggenheim exhibit. Lots of pretension; not much substance beyond that you can conjure up in your own mind.

Whilst this movie is cleverly based on the theory of relativity, quantum theory and the particle/ wave theory of the universe and demonstrates incredible technical expertise, in the end it's about someone finding herself interjected with repetitive  fight scenes and struggles to find an ending. Not surprising, I suppose, considering the title. I fast forwarded to find a finale for myself.

Everything Everywhere All at Once had lofty expectations to fill, and unfortunately it fails to deliver the five-star rating I was expecting going into the film.

There is nothing inherently wrong with the movie in general, there was a surface level plot with complex themes at play, which somehow balances the zany world of the multiverse with an intimate connection between mother and daughter. This connection had a nice arch throughout the story but failed to draw me in emotionally. I understood what I should feel in those impactful moments but had a hard time connecting.

The performances were great. Ke Huy Quan was incredible and one of the highlights of the entire movie. His switch from clueless doppy husband to multi-versal warrior had me hysterically laughing. Michelle Yeoh is fantastic and deserving of all her praise and award buzz.

Despite my problems with a lack of connection to the story, the action really raises this movie as a whole. There is something so captivating about 60-year-old women performing incredible complex kung fu against one another. The brutality is superb and incredibly fun to watch. Another layer to the action is the actions our characters must perform to tape into their mulit-versal selves. These are crazy, vulgar, and some of the most shocking things I have seen on screen.

Score: 85%
Verdict: Great

This movie is pure insanity! Its filled with the most insane ideas and concepts, it has some fantastic cinematography and action and at the same time, it is able to tell a heartfelt story about family. Everyone does a great job and the visuals are really good, despite the low budget. The way they explain the multiverse is both makes sense and works well with the story they tell. It was also pretty... nude. I don't know what else there is to say. This movie is pretty much perfect. Its a masterpiece.

This movie has it all!  Action, drama, comedy, science fiction and fantasy all mixed up in a movie that will both amaze, make you laugh/smile and pull at your heart strings all at once.  I highly recommend this movie to anyone that can relate to feeling like your life should of been different.  LOVED it!
Fun, crazy, action packed movie that is so fresh and totally different than anything seen in the past 10 years. Michelle Yeoh and all cast are amazing, VFX was great and the soundtrack prefect.

A Chinese effort at creating something new and blockbuster.  I was intrigued by a recommendation by Brian at church, but he was someone I didn't know.  It's true, this film is original, but almost too big to fail with all its investment and support.  It also couldn't decide what it was trying to be and faltered in trying.  The overlap in bizarre kung fu and randomness that was supposed to be humor at times sometimes fell flat.  But it just continued, like someone who didn't care about the someone watching them dancing by themselves.  Resurrecting shortround into acting was a nice move, but for most people, they may not have recognized him.  It was on a Redbox DVD.
The lead actress gives a great performance, but the story is predictable. Too many Matrix rip-off fight scenes. Had some good visually pleasing scenes though.
Wish I had read reviews on this movie before wasting my time. I loved the actors but the the story was terrible and all the weird sexual stuff was really unnecessary.

This was one of the most amazing movies I've ever seen. This is the sort of movie that will continue to be watched for generations. So much coming out right before and right after the pandemic seemed to be sequels, remakes, and just poorly written stories to grab some attention and make some money, as well as maybe get some brownie points for being politically correct, but this truly felt like art. It told a simple story of the love and miscommunications between an immigrant mother and her gay daughter, as well as a distant wife and sensitive husband (both hardworking), in a crazy complex and confusingly beautiful way. The visuals were just as amazing. I was drawn in the whole time and sobbing through half of it. It was truly an experience and something more screenwriters and directors should look up to. They took a lot of risks artistically, and they all seemed to work out wonderfully. I have never loved a movie more.

This movie was fantastic.  It's meditative but bombastic.  Tender but over-the-top.  Deeply sentimental but silly.  Stephanie Hsu gives an amazing performance.  Jamie Lee Curtis is wonderful.  Ke Huy Quan really ends up as this beautiful hero that you never see coming.  Michelle Yeoh is great.  And it has James Hong.  James-mutha-flippin-Hong.  What's not to love about that?  It's a beautiful story of a family choosing each other and choosing love.  

When the movie starts out so seriously and then turns, at times, to head-scratching absurdity, I never thought that the end of it would hit me so hard in the guts.  The screenplay is beautifully written and really shines where you don't think it will--in the most dramatic and sentimental parts.  

It's such a gutsy movie built around a challenging premise, but the payoff is well worth it.  If you aren't moved when the rock moves (#notreallyaspoiler) there's no hope for you as a person.
The over-hype machine won’t fool me. An amateur mess with actors clearly acting. If you are waiting for magic to happen after an hour, it doesn’t. Different does not always equal better.

The plot itself is extremely simple (not sure why a few have issues with understanding it).  If you don't want to follow the crazy universe hopping, which I can understand for older folk, it can be broken down to it's most simple of parts into a story about a fractured family with one single character in the very middle and mostly the cause of said familial problems.  The main character goes on an absolutely crazy adventure through different universes where they experience their life in completely different ways from the one they currently lead and the story plays out showing the effect of knowing such information has on them.
Heartfelt moments throughout the movie just made everything come together so perfectly. 

This movie deserves awards.

The movie has a  "Multiverse" like element but it doesn't bring it up multiple times. It allows us to absorb that information without it being annoying. This is how a Multiverse movie should be in my honest opinion. 

The movie does start off slow but it's to get a feel of each character and their personalities giving us an insight on how they behave and adapt throughout the film. 

The Action Scenes are Jackie Chan meets Kung Fu Hustle and it's done so well that you welcome these moments within the movie. 

Throughout the movie there are some moments that are uncanny, but to be honest. These moments don't come off very welcoming but they serve a purpose later on in the movie that provides an important role later on in the movie making it very hilarious, it gives you that "Oh now I see why that was placed there." "Oh that's why (Dot Dot Dot)" It doesn't make sense but later on it will add further humor to certain scenes throughout the movie. 

 You'll see exactly what I mean if you do decide on watching it.  

It does have some dark comedy, so this is not something for children. 
16+ should be fine. (Swearing) (Some Blood During Fight Scenes) (Mild uses of certain erotic toys) But (No Nudity) 

This movie was just outstanding overall. I loved the Characters and the Actors felt natural and the emotions were genuine. You can feel for each moment good, bad, awesome, weird, and understand that this is how a movie should be. 

I wouldn't skip on this movie. This truly deserves awards for its hard work and the great acting.


It's absolutely hilarious, gut-wrenching, wholesome, and even full of fantastically choreographed fight scenes all in a fantastic blend.  Even in the times when things become sad, they throw in some comedy that doesn't truly feel like it takes away from the moment but it does help alleviate the "feels" a bit. (Especially when the plot hits close to home for a lot of people)  I was able to laugh and cry at the same time without feeling like I was stretched too thin.

While I feel like the message behind the movie is extremely simple and can portrayed even without the crazy shenanigans of universe-hopping, this insanity is what gives the movie the character it needed to really elevate itself into something special.  Hell, the most touching moment in the movie for me was in one of these different universes and even though it was hilarious, I was still touched by the moment despite being able to laugh.

Heck, even though the movie is quite long (for me at least) it never felt like it was overstaying it's welcome and I never had that feeling of "okay, let's wrap this up." that I feel with 90% of movies in the theater.

Heavily recommend to most people, if they can deal with the off-the-wall shenanigans that occur. 
"Everything Everywhere All At Once" is an absolute tour de force on every sense you could experience from a film. In spans of less than five minutes, you could experience laughter, joy, confusion, anger, depression, fear, etc. as the story tells itself. The visuals, camera work, acting, choreography, costumes, lighting, sound design, set designs, EVERYTHING are flawlessly executed. There isn't a single moment where the movie isn't screaming for your attention. Through all that noise, there is a very deep, relatable, and real story of generational trauma, finding yourself, dealing with your flaws, and fighting to be who you are and for your family to understand you for it. Daniels have wowed me before with Swiss Army Man, my favorite movie of 2016. And now this film is my favorite of 2022, and perhaps even if the last five years. Do yourself a favor and give yourself a night to watch through this film, chew on it, and ask yourself if you're living your best life. A beautifully masterful film, a true masterpiece of it's time for sure, and hopefully will inspire other generations in the future.

This movie is a representation of the point where everything comes together in someone's life. It is the point at which two or more things come together to destroy each other and then form a new whole from their carnage. This movie took that point literally and implemented it as a multiversal problem.
One of the best films to come out in decades.
Szalony, niedorzeczny, dziwaczny i miejscami głupi oraz nielogiczny. Kuriozalne pomysły zaskakują widza historia jest wbrew pozorom prosta to na minus niestety
Ultimately creative & entertaining.  Jaimie Lee Curtis is a creature from the black lagoon.  Forget everything else and get ready to be entertained.  Wow!

No hyperbole, best movie I've ever seen. It made me laugh, gasp, cry, smile. The range of emotions it can offer is just like the title of the movie itself. I went in knowing nothing about it, which I think only enhanced the experience. There's a really deep, beautiful life lesson embedded in this movie, that presents itself so effortlessly that it doesn't feel artificial or like you're being lectured to. I genuinely feel like a better human being having watched it and this being my first theater experience, post-COVID, was a blessing.
literally the most amazing movie i have ever watch i didn't know what i was in for it was the most beautiful piece of film i have ever seen.
Amazing movie with lots of new ideas, nice CGI, good action, memorable characters and nice emotional core. Perhaps even my movie of the year 2022
Amazing, original, the most creative film to come out in ages. There is action, absurdity, and then profound emotional gut punch. Delivered beautifully by Michelle Yeoh and the rest of the cast.

I finally saw Everything, everywhere, all at once in theaters and I had skyline expectations and It didn't fully lived up to them. Overall I like the movie, but it's just not my humor man, I laughed once in a while and maybe it was a part because of my viewing experience, I was in a theater with 1 couple, who I think didn't knew which movie they were watching. Michelle Yeoh is fantastic in this role, I have no problem if she gets pushed for a Oscar nomination, Jonathan Ke Quan was amazing in his role, the rest was pretty good. But again for a part comedy, its not my type of humor. The Multiverse stuff was great, the VFX were stunning, the stunts and fights were amazing and I can see a lot of heart in this movie, especially the ending of course, but maybe I had a to high expectation

Brazilian portuguese language: Um filme necessário! Fazia quase um ano que não via um filme que me prendeu do começo ao fim. Minha mente explodiu tantas vezes assistindo que eu só não dou mais de cinco estrela porquê não da! É um filme com experiência única que quanto menos souber melhor então larga de preconceito por não ser um filme americano e vá assistir! Espero que ganhe o Oscar. 94/100

This movie is astounding! The acting is phenomenal and the actors all hit their notes perfectly. The cinematography is expert and inventive. While this is a bizarre and absurd ride, it is also incredibly moving, and in that way enacts its title and its message: amidst the barrage and sensory overload of the world--the internet, social media, 24-hr news cycles, space photos that tell us we are minute and irrelevant-- that caring about each other (even if only about characters in a movie) and being kind to each other amidst that uncertainty will keep us grounded, connected and will ultimately allow us to be each others' redemption. I hope this wins Everything, Everywhere, All At Once!

fave movie of the year!! so original, creative, suprising, funny and also made me quite emotional at times.. loved it so much! this take on the multiverse is so fun and interesting, I wish we could have more of it
The beginning is original but goes quickly to a silly hollywood BS…

This film is a mind-bending journey that takes audiences into a world of infinite possibilities and imaginatively quirky realms. The heart and soul of the film is built on relationships, challenging viewers to see the positives in the most dismal of situations - a skill all too necessary in the modern age. Make sure that none of your other-dimensional selves miss out on this flick!
Incredible story, action, and comedy all packed into one. One of the best movies I have seen ever! It probes deep elements of the human experience, in a highly enjoyable and entertaining way.
Absolutely amazing, first movie in a while that had be captivated, enthralled, enheartened, everything all at once.
Buckle up. This one is a good one.
Silly and largely unengaging movie....with kung fu.

Went in blind, had my mind blown. Unbelievable. In the moment, I wasn't a fan of so many random things, but every unnecessary indulgent dumb thing feels necessary to achieve the feeling of awe I now have. This movie subverted my expectations every other minute and took me on a ride I'll never forget. I've never watched anything that literally felt like my first time riding an intense roller-coaster (while deathly scared of them). Unforgettable, awe-inspiring, and without a doubt, one of the most shocking movies I've every watched. I wish everyone could have gone in blind like I did. When you lack understanding and aren't constantly guessing at the plot... it's magical. Truly felt like a kid watching this. I'm still blown away...
Peak entertainment when most films are solely superhero movies
Absolutely fantastic and emotionally moving. So much fun, so many great ideas, wonderful performances on almost everyone's behalf.
I really loved the concept of this movie and the message but I can't lie I did get bored/sleepy at a few parts. Still a great movie

Wow, what a visually stunning masterpiece. I tend to judge movies based on the emotional response they elicit for me and this one hits square in the chest. I laughed, I cried, I swooned: I want to watch this over and over again and then share it with anyone and everyone. Everything, Everywhere is refreshingly new and noteworthy. A completely original film with a beautifully powerful message. Well done.

You have to get through the first 2 hours of Martial Arts in the Multiverse to get to the last brilliant 20 minutes of Everything Everywhere All At Once. But in the end, it all makes sense and ties things together. Fun seeing Jamie Lee Curtis as the IRS Agent. Oscar-caliber performance by Michelle Yeoh.
Interesting premise, that could only be pulled off with great acting - and it was.  Michele Yeoh was amazing.
Absolutely bonkers... and absolutely delightful.

Love love love Michelle Yeoh and everything she does. And the filmmakers have some fun, unorthodox stories to tell. This story is a little less impactful than intended. The mother-daughter relationship lacks real empathy from this filmgoer, and as such, did not pull off the ultimate goal. That aside it was a fun and inventive film with some excellent performances. Take a chance and watch this one!
A fun and quirky film. Worth a watch.

I've never cried at a movie, and this one sadly didn't make me cry either, but it's the hardest I've ever wanted to cry watching a movie. The characters are absolutely a tour-de-force of acting prowess, portrayed excellently(with a wonderful Jamie Lee Curtis cameo), and the emotion is overpowering in the best possible way. One of my favorite movies ever, watch it!!
Unusual yet interesting take on the multiverse. Worth it!
Made ordinary family stories special through the multiverse.
Excellent time lapse of your cultural nuances that are sometimes too sensitive to poke .
Drink a lot of coffee before watching this one. For a movie this chaotic and dreamlike, two hours is way too long. It's demanding, exhausting and, frankly, I was relieved when it was over.
One of the most emotional and ridiculous movies of all time.
Similar to Rick and Morty thought process and philosophy with some unnecessary comic and sexual references. Still, it is a better understanding of the multiverse than Marvel.

This movie was too confused, too silly, and too long. I really don't understand why everyone likes it so much. As my wife said to me after watching it the entire point of the movie is the protaganist's reconciliation with her family. Oh, and she saves the universe at the same time.
I would have rather seen a thoughtful movie about familial reconciliation without all the confusion and silliness.
My rating includes one extra star for the great wire-work stunts and martial arts. The performances are all also very good. Otherwise one-half star.
could have been like 20 min shorter, that second act really drags, but its impact is undeniable

I just didn't enjoy anything about it. I definitely felt some concern for tue characters, they were developed ok. But the concept was just too over the top to take seriously and the pace just gave me a headache.

Overall, let me ask you, have you ever been on a wild roller-coaster?  Well, welcome to the equivalent experience in cinema.  This film is witty and wild!  Nothing about it is ever boring.  Instead, it is highly creative and clever, and I adored that the cast committed everything they had towards it, including its lead, Michelle Yeoh, who is, again, tremendous.  Sure, a film about the multiverse may seem to be a familiar concept.  Still, viewers will feel many emotions and have a blast experiencing it thanks to clever visuals, costuming, and touching themes about family and relationships.  It's almost perfect as a film, but some gags don't quite land on the right foot.  As for the plot, it's filled with entertainment and energy.  There is so much to see while travelling around the multiverse in this film that I cannot wait to conduct another rewatch in cinemas to better understand some aspects of this crazy and amusing film.
This was one of the worst movies I've ever seen.  It was just a mess.  I don't understand all the hoo-la around this movie.  An Oscar contender?  What am I missing here?
I can't understand how anyone would like this movie. This was the strangest and worst movie I have seen. This movie sucked so bad.

As popularity for this movie grew, I hate to admit it but, the more disinterested I became. I personally don't like when I feel I'm being told to like a film. This happens every now and then when a film garners support to such an overwhelming degree that I grow more worried to actually see it. I guess what I'm saying is I don't like having expectations; yet another reason why  I avoid trailers like the bubonic plague. So I, regrettably, walked into this movie filled with expectations. I am happy to report that some were irrefutably fulfilled, and some were not. The unsung heroes of post-production are largely responsible for the former as Paul Rogers delivers a stellar performance in the editing chair. Speaking of stellar performances, it is about time that Michelle Yeoh be recognized for her immense talent. Oscar-winning talent as Evelyn? I'm not so sure. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed her "baby deer learning how to walk" in the context of a multiverse---pure entertainment. Stephanie Hsu as the ironically named Joy and Ke Huy Quan as Waymond fill in the gaps beautifully and bring the screenplay back down to reality in moments where it is needed most to reveal a touching familial undertone that is crucial for the success of the exposition. My issues arise in pacing. After doing the intense field work of asking two of my friends it is clear that I am not unique in thinking this way. While this is certainly not the first film to deal heavily with a multiverse, introduction to said multiverse is key. As viewer of generation z, it seems concerning how often I had to play catch up. I think this issue in understanding begins at the first sight of the multiverse. There is not enough time for audience digestion of one particular plot point so when it comes time to introduce another (which is extremely quickly with this film), it seems easier to just give up and be confused. I shouldn't have to rely on my own willingness to decode to enjoy the supposed, "most entertaining movie of the year". This said, the innovation and just flat out ridiculousness of Everything Everywhere All At Once far outweighs any conception issues I had with it. You know a movie is keeping you engaged when you stare at two rocks in conversation completely enamored. Is this the greatest movie ever made? I don't think so. Will it make you feel something? Yes. Definitely not one to miss out on.

The biggest complaint I have is that the movie seemed to start at the end of the first act. The setup of this "world" seemingly happened for the sake of happening. If you can accept the premise, then you will enjoy the movie. 

For me, it didn't earn my attention. I found myself watching the movie and liking the concepts, but not caring. It felt like I knew the ending before it came. Usually this wouldn't bother me, but I thought about the ending because I wanted it to come faster than it did. Most of the meat of the movie is good, but nothing is ever great. 

With an almost no first act, it's like a tripod with 2 legs that slowly toppled over. The top of the tripod was filled with good acting, good action, good direction... but none of it was strong enough to support a score better than just above average.
I thoroughly enjoyed this
Impressive piece of work . Shows multimillion movie making studios the right way to do creative stuff. Great actors & a well made movie overall
Yet another overrated movie of 2022. We turned off the movie halfway through because we didn't know what was going on - which is never, um, a good thing for us.
Very entertaining, interesting concept. I would like to see non-comedy film in that universe.

The best movie I've seen in a long time. It had action, adventure,  humour, and at its core an extremely heart warming story about a family trying to reconnect with each other. 

Marvel/Disney take note! This is how a multiverse movie should be done.

The trailer really down plays the movie. It is an emotional roller coaster and not once do you lose the main story line of a mothers love for her daughter. If you haven't watched this yet. Please, please watch it, there is so much effort put into the lighting, the music, the sound design, the costumes but more importantly the martial art training and fight sequences.

This could have been the best picture of the year in the hands of a strong editor or studio in control of the final cut. Unfortunately at 2 hours and 20 minutes, the film overstays its welcome as the charming off-beat premise becomes self-indulgent and overworked. The closest cinematic comparison I can make is to Being John Malkovitch, which was able to reign itself into a shorter time frame, while still thinking outside the box. In EEAAO, we have multiple simultaneous realities unfolding for each character, in a fashion many students of metaphysics believe to be the true nature of human existence. The fact that someone, ANYONE, was willing to take this concept and fashion it into a humorous cinematic experience certainly deserves some props.

Um filme inteligente e emotivo que prende, em casa segundo, a atenção de quem o está assistindo.
Aos que não gostaram, me perdoem, vocês não só entenderam o filme, como precisam aprender grande parte do que ele ensina.

Stunning film in every respect. This was another one that I didn't catch in the theaters but I did get streaming, and man do I wish I had seen it on the big screen.

Adored this film and now I just have to get my husband to watch it with me!
This was wonderful! Film of the year

it's very difficult to do something new. We live in an era where it seems like everything has already been created. In terms of cinema, we've already seen a lot of films about the multiverse. But what has been done here is something exceptional. He took the idea to a higher level. A lot of creativity and a very well done job. Whether it's possible to do something new these days I don't know, but taking a concept and turning it into something memorable and expansive, this movie showed that it's possible.

Utter stupid movie with bad acting and plots. It's super confusing and I can hardly finish it. It's so boring and lack personality and such an unrelateable movie. Those who like it probably were bots or paid to write good things about it.

a pesar de su poca publicidad y al comienzo parece un poco aburrida...ME ATREVO A DECIR QUE ES UNA DE LAS MEJORES PELICULAS DE TODOS LOS TIEMPOS,sus cinematografia es perfecta,gion de los mejores. 3 tramas que son el multiverso,el tema familiar y la aceptacion en esta pelicula es realmente PERFECTO 10/10

Everything might seem like it's going everywhere but it all flows in the same direction with a purpose. Near the end it starts an emotional roller coaster with the profoundness of Lovecraftian imagery in its storytelling.
If someone leaves this movie and hasn't felt anything, then somebody better call 911 because that person is clinically dead.
simple yet effective, my mind was blown open wide, simply amazing movie, it made me lough and cry over and over again.simply brilliant.
Interesting and fairly unique. Could have done some things better, but had some decent/funny fight scenes which kept my eyes on the screen for sure.
Fun enough. Feels kinda redundant considering all the multiverse stuff in MCU and Rick and Morty. Doesn't really add any unique twists to the concept, but is competent enough.

I had heard a great deal of buzz about this movie.  I streamed it from the Showtime app and it was an amazing experience.  A great fun take on a multiverse.  A wonderful cast and the movie keeps you on the edge of your seat.
Movie of the year. Intelligent and absolutely overwhelming. An ambitious movie that manages to fully deliver thanks to great performances and inspired directing.

Absolutely amazing! This movie let me feel every single emotion; I laughed out loud, cried like a baby. The cinematography was stunning, the soundtrack was perfect, the characters were relatable and very human and the overall story was heartwarming and well-thoughtout! I recommend it to all of my friends and family and have bought it on pretty much every platform. One of the best movies of 2022 and astoundingly refreshing, after seeing all the flops that came out this year.

A long, wild, spellbinding ride into absurdity and back that lands firmly with a satisfying and maybe teary-eyed ending—all in typical Daniels fashion with outstanding and refreshing performances all around.

This movie assaults your senses with bonkers visuals, offbeat humor, and an interesting sci-fi premise.  Well acted, well crafted, and never dull, this film also never loses the heart at its core.  It has a lot to say about the value of family, kindness, and being grateful in an age that sorely lacks these sentiments, as well as about growing up in the current landscape of information overload.  This may be the strangest, yet most entertaining and thought-provoking movie to make me laugh hysterically and cry tears of sadness and joy all in the span of two hours.

A clear unexpected hit of 2022, EEAAO is by far the best best taje on the Multiverse trend of the early '20s. Michelle Yeoh is the perfect fit as lead, the script is clean and you can see the love put in by all involved tomake this one of the best movies of 2022.

I've watched this movie a while ago and I watched it multiple times in theater. Didn't get the chance to rate it on here so here I go. It's an amazing movie. I laughed, I cried, and both all at once. Michelle Yeoh, Ke Huy Quan, Stephanie Hsu, and Jamie Lee Curtis gives amazing performances. This is probably one of my favorite movies of all time. A24 brings us this amazing film by the Daniels. Highly recommend it.

The ever brilliant Michelle Yeoh headlines a wonderful kick ass sci-fi family drama.

Overflowing with originality and quirky silly humour.
One of my top 5 films of the year. Michelle Yeoh is long overdue for an Academy Award. Give it to her NOW!
Absolute tripe - a veiled rip off The Matrix and Avengers multiverse themes. Playing Michelle Yeoh's popularity to try and sell something that should not have been made.
Initially intriguing, but it gets tiring and messy, unnecessarily flashy. Also, I think this film is made for non-Asians with all the stereotypes. I'm Asian, hence the score.

This film was worth the effort it took to watch it and try and follow along! Really incredible acting by all. Ranks right up there with The Fifth Element, Inception,  the Matrix films, and so many great mind-benders.
One of the most uniquely beautiful movies I've ever seen.

One if not the best movie of the year.
Michelle Yeoh need to get an Oscar. 100%
Original, fun, and thoughtful. Michelle Yeoh delivers one of her best performances and deserves an Oscar.
Me fascino toda la película, excelentes actuaciones, la historia, los efectos, todo me gusto, se ha convertido en una de mis peliculas favoritas.
